menu package#

Submodules#

menu.budget module#

This module contains the budget menu. It gets user selection to set overall budget; for week, month or year, set budget by category; for week month or year, view budgets, view budget progress; for week month or year or return to main menu.

class menu.budget.Budget(category, term, amount)[source]#

Bases: object

This class represents a budget

amount#

budget amount

Type:

float

term#

‘weekly’, ‘monthly’ or ‘annual’

Type:

str

get_all_att:

returns attributes of Budget object

get_all_att()[source]#

This method returns the attributes of a Budget object.

Parameters:

self – Budget object

Returns:

Tuple containing Budget attributes

menu.budget.budget_menu()[source]#

This function gets user choice for the budget menu and calls the relevant function according to user’s selection

Returns:

None

menu.budget.get_budgets()[source]#

This function gets a list of budgets from the budget table

Returns:

list of budgets

Return type:

list of tuples

menu.budget.get_budgets_by_term(term)[source]#

This function gets a list of budgets in a term

Parameters:

term – ‘weekly’, ‘monthly’ or ‘annual’

Returns:

list of budgets in term

Return type:

list of tuples

menu.budget.get_existing_gross()[source]#

This function gets the current values set for gross income goal

Returns:

existing amounts for gross income

Return type:

float

menu.budget.get_expenses_by_date(term)[source]#

This function gets a list of rows from expenses table which match each day in a list of days

Parameters:

term – ‘weekly’, ‘monthly’ or ‘annual’

Returns:

list of rows from expenses table

Return type:

list of tuples

This function gets a list of Expense objects in a term

Parameters:

term – ‘weekly’, ‘monthly’, or ‘yearly’

Returns:

list of Expense objects

Return type:

list of objects

menu.budget.overall_progress(term)[source]#

This function prints overall budget progress in a specified term

Parameters:

term – ‘weekly’, ‘monthly’ or ‘annual’

Returns:

None

menu.budget.print_budgets(list_of_budgets)[source]#

This function prints a list of budgets

Parameters:

list_of_budgets – list of rows from budget table

Returns:

None

menu.budget.print_overall(budget_goal, total, remain, term)[source]#

This function prints overall budget progress for a budget

Parameters:

  • budget_goal – budget amount

  • total – total spending

  • remain – amount of money remaining in budget

  • term – ‘weekly’, ‘monthly’ or ‘annual’

Returns:

None

menu.budget.print_progress(progress_list)[source]#

This function prints budget progress for each progress in a list

Parameters:

progress_list – list of progress for each budget

Returns:

None

menu.budget.set_budget()[source]#

This function gets a term and an amount for a new budget from the user and calls function to update tables

Returns:

None

menu.budget.set_budget_by_category()[source]#

This function sets a budget for a selected category

Returns:

None

menu.budget.update_overall_budgets(term, amount)[source]#

This function updates the values in the budget table for a new budget

Parameters:

  • term – ‘weekly’, ‘monthly’, or ‘annual’

  • amount – budget amount

Returns:

None

menu.budget.view_budgets()[source]#

This function prints all budgets

Returns:

None

menu.budget.view_progress_by_term(term)[source]#

This function prints a budget progress by category in a specified term

Parameters:

term – ‘weekly’, ‘monthly’ or ‘annual’

Returns:

None

menu.create_graph module#

This module gets all arguments to create a graph showing progress for a financial goal.

menu.create_graph.create_budget_graph()[source]#

This function calls the function to create a graph with the arguments to show progress towards annual budget goal.

Returns:

None

menu.create_graph.create_gross_income_graph()[source]#

This function calls the function to create a graph with the arguments to show progress towards annual gross income goal.

Returns:

None

menu.create_graph.create_net_income_graph()[source]#

This function calls the function to create a graph with the arguments to show progress towards annual net income goal.

Returns:

None

menu.create_graph.get_amount_from_rows(row_list)[source]#

This function takes in a list of rows from expenses or income tables and returns a list of their amounts

Parameters:

row_list – list of rows from table

Returns:

list of amounts

Return type:

list of floats

menu.create_graph.get_average_so_far_for_each_week_in_year(amount_list)[source]#

This function gets the average amount spent or earned so far this year on the first day of each week of the year.

Parameters:

amount_list – list of floats

Returns:

cumulative averages

Return type:

list

menu.create_graph.get_budget_args()[source]#

This function gets the arguments specific to the progress in the annual budget goal.

Returns:

weekly budget, total spent in each week, average spent

Return type:

float, list, list

menu.create_graph.get_common_args()[source]#

This function gets the arguments to create a graph showing progress towards a financial goal which are common to all goals.

Parameters:

goal – ‘net income’, ‘gross income’ or ‘budget’

Returns:

None

menu.create_graph.get_gross_args()[source]#

This function gets all arguments specific to the progress in the annual gross income goal.

Returns:

target gross, total gross for each week, average gross

Return type:

float, list, list

menu.create_graph.get_income_for_week(dates_list)[source]#

This function gets the total income for each week in a list of dates.

Parameters:

dates_list – list of dates of start of each week this year

Returns:

list of total income for each week

Return type:

list of floats

menu.create_graph.get_labels(goal)[source]#

This function gets the labels to plot graph according to goal.

Parameters:

goal – ‘net income’, ‘gross income’, ‘budget

Returns:

labels

Return type:

tuple of str

menu.create_graph.get_net_args()[source]#

This function gets all arguments specific to the progress in the annual net income goal.

Returns:

target net, total net for each week, average net

Return type:

float, list, list

menu.create_graph.get_spending_for_week(dates_list)[source]#

This function gets the total spending for each week from a list of dates.

Parameters:

dates_list – list of dates of start of each week this year

Returns:

list of total spend for each week

Return type:

list of floats

menu.create_graph.get_x_coordinates(dates_list)[source]#

This function takes in a list of dates and returns a list with a week number for each date.

Parameters:

dates_list – list of dates

Returns:

list of numbers for each week in year so far

Return type:

list of int

menu.expenses module#

This module contains the expenses menu. It gets user choice to add expense, view expenses by category; over a selected term, manage categories or return to main menu. It also contains all relevant functions to get the required returns for each selection.

class menu.expenses.Expense(date, expense, amount, category)[source]#

Bases: object

This class represents an expense.

date#

date expense was entered

Type:

str

expense#

description of expense

Type:

str

amount#

amount the expense cost

Type:

float

category#

category of expense

Type:

str

get_all_att:

returns attributes of expense

insert_expense:

enters new expense into expenses table

This method returns the attributes of an Expense object.

Parameters:

self – Expense object

Returns:

Tuple containing Expense attributes

insert_expense()[source]#

This method enters a new expense into the ‘expenses’ table.

Parameters:

self – Expense object

Returns:

None

menu.expenses.add_expense()[source]#

This function calls functions to insert expense into table and prints a message to user.

Returns:

None

menu.expenses.categories_menu()[source]#

This function presents the user with options to manage expense categories and calls relevant functions according to user selection

Returns:

None

menu.expenses.expense_menu()[source]#

This function manages the user selection from the expense menu calls the relevant functions according to the menu selection

Returns:

None

This function prints a list of expenses in a selected category

None

rows from expenses table

Return type:

menu.expenses.view_categories()[source]#

This function prints all categories for the user to select from

Returns:

None

menu.goals module#

This module contains the goals menu. It gets user choice to set financial goals; by net or gross income, weekly, monthly or annually, view progress towards financial goals; for gross income, net income or budget and cancel; return to main menu. It also contains all relevant functions to get the required returns for each selection.

menu.goals.get_annual(goal)[source]#

This function gets annual goal

Parameters:

goal – ‘gross income’ or ‘net income’

Returns:

amount of money or None

Return type:

float or None

menu.goals.get_gross_or_net()[source]#

This function gets user choice for setting a financial goal

Returns:

‘gross income’ or ‘net income’

Return type:

str

menu.goals.get_no_weeks()[source]#

This function gets a list of integers corresponding to the length of a list of dates. This is for the x-coordinates for plotting graph.

Returns:

list of integers

Return type:

list of int

menu.goals.goals_menu()[source]#

This function gets user selection for the financial goals menu and calls relevant functions according to user choice

Returns:

None

menu.goals.set_financial_goals(gross_or_net)[source]#

This function sets a financial goal for gross or net income for user’s selected term.

Parameters:

gross_or_net – str ‘gross income’ or ‘net income’

Returns:

None

menu.goals.update_gross_income(new_gross)[source]#

This function updates values in budget table for a new gross income

Parameters:

new_gross – amount for new gross income

Returns:

None

menu.goals.update_net_income(new_net)[source]#

This function updates values in budget table for a new net income

Parameters:

new_net – amount for new net income

Returns:

None

menu.goals.view_progress()[source]#

This function handles the progress menu and calls the relevant functions from user choice

Returns:

None

menu.income module#

This module contains the income menu. It gets user choice to add income, view income, manage income sources; view sources of income, edit income source, add new income source, or return to main menu. It also contains all relevant functions to get the required returns for each selection.

class menu.income.Income(date, source, amount)[source]#

Bases: object

This class represents an income.

Returns:

None

menu.main_menu module#

This module is the main menu. It gets the user choice for expenses, income, budget, financial goals or to exit the programme.

References

[1] Stack Overflow (for the function display_message) https://stackoverflow.com/questions/71675811/how-do-i-make-a-delay-in-the-printing-of-each-letter-in-my-code # noqa

menu.main_menu.display_message(message)[source]#

This function displays welcome and goodbye messages with a time delay

Parameters:

message – welcome or goodbye message for user

Returns:

None

menu.main_menu.main_menu()[source]#

Gets the user selection from the main menu and calls relevant module from selection

Returns:

None
